other_tests.findings: Postoperative changes from cholecystectomy are noted. Small amount of fluid is noted within the gallbladder fossa, presumably postoperative in nature. The common bile duct is normal in caliber and contour, without evidence of filling defects, measuring approximately 5 mm in caliber. Mild prominence of the intrahepatic ducts centrally; otherwise unremarkable. No periductal enhancement and no liver lesions. Right kidney has a hyperintense lesion on T2-weighted sequences that is uniformly dark on T1-weighted sequences, with two foci of nodular enhancement and a suggestion of an enhancing thick septation. Findings are nonspecific; cystic renal neoplasm cannot be excluded. Left kidney is unremarkable. No hydronephrosis. Abdominal aorta and its major branches are normal.
